abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Technical Assistance and Hospital
            Rehabilitation Project (TAHRP) in Chile. The Project aims to
            develop and launch a sector-wide policy, institutional and
            operational reforms through various technical studies,
            pilot-tests and start-up operation of some reform measures
            (Sectoral Reform Preparation) and improve the quality and
            efficiency of public hospital services. Bank performance
            over the whole project cycle was in general outstanding,
            except for occasionally slack supervision. Borrower's
            performance during preparation was highly satisfactory. Some
            of the key lessons learned includes: a) It is prudent and
            flexible for the Bank to finance a sectoral reform
            preparatory project before launching a sector-wide reform
            program. b) It is essential to carry out a strong public
            dissemination and education campaign for the sectoral reform
            program to alleviate any possible resistance to it. c) It is
            practical to start most reform measures with Executive
            decrees or regulations rather than legislative actions. d)
            Decentralization should be accompanied by measures to ensure
            accountability and equity among decentralized entities. e)
            Successful cost-recovery requires incentives for agencies to
            retain revenues collected. f) Monitoring and evaluation
            should receive greater attention from the beginning of the
            reform. g) The Bank should reinforce its advantage to
            provide policy advice and technical assistance. h) The Bank
            should accelerate its loan agreement amendment processes.
